(default)
Class CefBrowserHost

CefBase
   |
   +--CefBrowserHost
   in cef_browser.h
class CefBrowserHost
extends CefBase

Class used to represent the browser process aspects of a browser window. The methods of this class can only be called in the browser process. They may be called on any thread in that process unless otherwise indicated in the comments.

Method Detail

CloseBrowser

public virtual void CloseBrowser()= 0;
Closes this browser window.

CreateBrowser

public static bool CreateBrowser( const CefWindowInfo& windowInfo, CefRefPtr< CefClient > client, const CefString& url, const CefBrowserSettings& settings );
Create a new browser window using the window parameters specified by |windowInfo|. All values will be copied internally and the actual window will be created on the UI thread. This method can be called on any browser process thread and will not block.

CreateBrowserSync

public static CefRefPtr< CefBrowser > CreateBrowserSync( const CefWindowInfo& windowInfo, CefRefPtr< CefClient > client, const CefString& url, const CefBrowserSettings& settings );
Create a new browser window using the window parameters specified by |windowInfo|. This method can only be called on the browser process UI thread.

GetBrowser

public virtual CefRefPtr< CefBrowser > GetBrowser()= 0;
Returns the hosted browser object.

GetClient

public virtual CefRefPtr< CefClient > GetClient()= 0;
Returns the client for this browser.

GetDevToolsURL

public virtual CefString GetDevToolsURL( bool http_scheme )= 0;
Returns the DevTools URL for this browser. If |http_scheme| is true the returned URL will use the http scheme instead of the chrome-devtools scheme. Remote debugging can be enabled by specifying the "remote-debugging-port" command-line flag or by setting the CefSettings.remote_debugging_port value. If remote debugging is not enabled this method will return an empty string.

GetOpenerWindowHandle

public virtual CefWindowHandle GetOpenerWindowHandle()= 0;
Retrieve the window handle of the browser that opened this browser. Will return NULL for non-popup windows. This method can be used in combination with custom handling of modal windows.

GetWindowHandle

public virtual CefWindowHandle GetWindowHandle()= 0;
Retrieve the window handle for this browser.

GetZoomLevel

public virtual double GetZoomLevel()= 0;
Get the zoom level. This method can only be called on the UI thread.

ParentWindowWillClose

public virtual void ParentWindowWillClose()= 0;
Call this method before destroying a contained browser window. This method performs any internal cleanup that may be needed before the browser window is destroyed.

SetFocus

public virtual void SetFocus( bool enable )= 0;
Set focus for the browser window. If |enable| is true focus will be set to the window. Otherwise, focus will be removed.

SetZoomLevel

public virtual void SetZoomLevel( double zoomLevel )= 0;
Change the zoom level to the specified value.
